SEARCH
Package edu.byu.ece.rapidSmith.device

Class Device

java.lang.Object
edu.byu.ece.rapidSmith.device.Device
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class Device extends Object implements Serializable
This is the main class that stores information about each Xilinx part. It contains a 2D grid of Tiles which contain all the routing and primitive sites necessary for a placer and router.
Author:
Chris Lavin Created on: Apr 22, 2010
See Also:
  • Serialized Form

  • Constructor Details

    • Device

      public Device()
      Constructor, initializes all objects to new, except tile[][]

  • Method Details

    • getInstance

      public static Device getInstance(String partName)
      This method is intended to only be called by a special method, util.FileTools.loadDevice(). This will either return a populated device of the same part if it already exists in memory as the singleton instance or a new device ready to be populated from a file.
      Parameters:
      partName - The part name of the device to get.
      Returns:
      If no device has been loaded or the part names do not match the singleton instance, it returns a new Device, otherwise it will return an existing copy of the device in memory.

    • getWireEnumerator

      public WireEnumerator getWireEnumerator()
      Gets the corresponding wire enumerator object for this device.
      Returns:
      The wire enumerator for this device.

    • createTileArray

      protected void createTileArray()
      Initializes the tile array and wire pool. This is done after the tile dimensions have been parsed from the .xdlrc file.

    • isRouteThrough

      public boolean isRouteThrough(WireConnection w)
      Checks if this wire is RouteThrough.
      Parameters:
      w - The wire to test.
      Returns:
      True if the wire is a routeThrough, false otherwise.

    • getPrimitiveExternalPin

      public Integer getPrimitiveExternalPin(Pin pin)
      Gets the external wire enumeration on the instance pin.
      Parameters:
      pin - The pin to get the external name from.
      Returns:
      The wire enumeration of the internal pin on the instance primitive of pin.

    • getNodeFromPin

      public Node getNodeFromPin(Pin pin)
      This will creating a routing node from the pin given.
      Parameters:
      pin - The pin to create the routing node from.
      Returns:
      A new node populated with the pin's tile and wire. The parent field is null and level is zero.

    • getNodeFromPin

      public Node getNodeFromPin(Pin pin, Node parent, int level)
      This will creating a routing node from the pin given.
      Parameters:
      pin - The pin to create the routing node from.
      Returns:
      A new node populated with the pin's tile and wire. The parent field is null and level is zero.

    • getRouteThrough

      public PIPRouteThrough getRouteThrough(WireConnection w)
      Gets the PIPRouteThrough object for a wire.
      Parameters:
      w - The wire which has a corresponding PIPRouteThrough
      Returns:
      The PIPRouteThrough or null if it does not exist.

    • getTile

      public Tile getTile(int row, int column)
      Gets the current tile in the device based on absolute row and column indices
      Parameters:
      row - The absolute row index (0 starting at top)
      column - The absolute column index (0 starting at the left)
      Returns:
      The tile specified by row and column, if the indices are out of bounds it returns null

    • getTile

      public Tile getTile(String tile)
      This will get a Tile by its name using a HashMap.
      Parameters:
      tile - The name of the tile to get.
      Returns:
      The tile with the name tile, or null if it does not exist.

    • getTile

      public Tile getTile(int uniqueTileNumber)
      Each tile in a device can be referenced by a unique integer which is a combination of its row and column index. This will get and return the tile with the unique index provided.
      Parameters:
      uniqueTileNumber - The unique tile number of the tile to get.
      Returns:
      The tile with the uniqueTileNumber, or null if none exists.

    • getPrimitiveSite

      public PrimitiveSite getPrimitiveSite(String name)
      This gets and returns a primitive site on the device by name.
      Parameters:
      name - Name of the primitive site to get.
      Returns:
      The primitive site with the name, or null if none exists.

    • getCorrespondingPrimitiveSite

      public static PrimitiveSite getCorrespondingPrimitiveSite(PrimitiveSite current, PrimitiveType type, Tile newSiteTile)
      A method to get the corresponding primitive site for current in a different tile. For example in a Virtex 4, there are 4 slices in a CLB tile, when moving a hard macro the current slice must go in the same spot in a new CLB tile
      Parameters:
      current - The current primitive site of the instance.
      newSiteTile - The tile of the new proposed site.
      Returns:
      The corresponding site in tile newSite, or null if no corresponding site exists.

    • getSwitchMatrixSink

      public Node getSwitchMatrixSink(Pin pin)
      This will take a sink Pin from a design net and determine the final switch matrix and node or wire which the signal must be routed through in order to reach the sink pin.
      Parameters:
      pin - The sink pin to find a switch matrix for.
      Returns:
      A node (a unique tile and wire) of where the signal must be routed to reach the sink pin. Returns null, if none exists.

    • getSwitchMatrixTypes

      public HashSet<TileType> getSwitchMatrixTypes()
      This will return a set of all unique TileTypes which are considered to have a switch matrix or routing switch box in them.
      Returns:
      A set of all TileTypes which have a switch matrix in them.

    • getRows

      public int getRows()
      Gets and returns the number of rows of tiles in this device.
      Returns:
      the number of rows of tiles in the device.

    • setRows

      protected void setRows(int rows)
      Sets the number of rows of tiles this device has.
      Parameters:
      rows - the number of rows of tiles to set in the device.

    • getColumns

      public int getColumns()
      Gets and returns the number of columns of tiles in this device.
      Returns:
      the number of columns of tiles in the device.

    • setColumns

      protected void setColumns(int columns)
      Sets the number of columns of tiles this device has.
      Parameters:
      columns - the number of columns of tiles to set in the device

    • getTiles

      public Tile[][] getTiles()
      Gets and returns this device's 2D array of tiles that define the layout of the FPGA.
      Returns:
      the tiles of this device.

    • getPartName

      public String getPartName()
      Gets and return the partName (includes package but not speed grade) of this device (ex: xc4vfx12ff668).
      Returns:
      the partName The part name of this device.

    • getExactFamilyType

      public FamilyType getExactFamilyType()
      Gets and returns the all lower case exact Xilinx family type for this device (ex: qvirtex4 instead of virtex4). DO NOT use exact family methods if it is to be used for accessing device or wire enumeration files as RapidSmith does not generate files for devices that have XDLRC compatible files.
      Returns:
      The exact Xilinx family type for this device.

    • getFamilyType

      public FamilyType getFamilyType()
      Gets and returns the base family type for this device. This ensures compatibility with all RapidSmith files. For differentiating family types (qvirtex4 rather than virtex4) use getExactFamilyType().
      Returns:
      The base family type of the part for this device.

    • setPartName

      protected void setPartName(String partName)
      Sets the part name of this device. This part name should only have the package information but not speed grade (ex: xc4vfx12ff668).
      Parameters:
      partName - the partName to set.

    • getPrimitiveSites

      public HashMap<String,PrimitiveSite> getPrimitiveSites()
      Gets and returns the HashMap of name to primitive site mappings for this device.
      Returns:
      The map of name to primitive site mappings for this device.

    • getTileMap

      public HashMap<String,Tile> getTileMap()
      Gets and returns the HashMap of name to Tile mappings for this device.
      Returns:
      The tile mappings of name to Tile object for this device.

    • getRouteThroughMap

      public HashMap<WireConnection,PIPRouteThrough> getRouteThroughMap()
      Gets and returns the PIP route through map for this device.
      Returns:
      The mappings between wires and PIP route throughs.

    • getPrimitiveSiteIndex

      public ArrayList<PrimitiveSite[]> getPrimitiveSiteIndex()
      This method will get (create if null) a data structure which stores all of the device's primitive sites by type. To get all of the primitive sites of a particular type, use the PrimitiveType.ordinal() method to get the representative integer and use that value to index into the ArrayList. This will return an array of all primitive sites of that same type.
      Returns:
      The data structure which stores all of the primitive sites separated by type.

    • getCompatibleSiteIndex

      public ArrayList<PrimitiveSite[]> getCompatibleSiteIndex()
      This method will get (create if null) a data structure which stores all of the compatible primitive sites for each primitive type. To get all the compatible primitive sites of a particular type, use the PrimitiveType.ordinal() method to get the representative integer and use that value to index into the ArrayList. This will return an array of all compatible primitive sites of that same type.
      Returns:
      The data structure which stores all compatible primitive sites for each primitive type.

    • getAllPrimitiveSitesOfType

      public PrimitiveSite[] getAllPrimitiveSitesOfType(PrimitiveType type)
      This method will get all primitive sites with the same base type as that passed as a parameter type. This does not get all compatible sites for the PrimitiveType type as a SLICEL request would only return all SLICEL type sites and no SLICEM types which can also be a valid site for SLICELs.
      Parameters:
      type - The types of sites to retrieve.
      Returns:
      An array of primitive sites with the same Primitive type as type.

    • getAllCompatibleSites

      public PrimitiveSite[] getAllCompatibleSites(PrimitiveType type)
      This method will get all compatible primitive sites for a particular primitive type in this device. For example, a SLICEL can be placed at all SLICEL sites AND all SLICEM sites. If the type given were SLICEL, this method would return an array of all SLICEL and SLICEM sites.
      Parameters:
      type - The type for which to find compatible primitive sites.
      Returns:
      An array of compatible sites suitable for placement of a primitive of type type.

    • getAllSitesOfType

      public PrimitiveSite[] getAllSitesOfType(PrimitiveType type)
      Gets and returns an array of all primitive sites of the given primitive type.
      Parameters:
      type - The primitive type of the site to get.
      Returns:
      An array of all primitive sites in the device with primitive type type.

    • populateTileMap

      protected void populateTileMap(HashMap<String,Integer> map)
      This method populated the tile map after parsing is complete.
      Parameters:
      map - A map necessary to make a link between names of tiles and objects.

    • populateSinkPins

      public void populateSinkPins(WireEnumerator we)
      This method will iterate through all of the sink pins of the device and determine which switch matrix and wire node a routed path must pass through in order to arrive at the sink.
      Parameters:
      we - The corresponding wire enumerator for this device.

    • removeDuplicateTileSinks

      protected void removeDuplicateTileSinks(WireEnumerator we)
      This finds all of the unique tile sink HashMaps. This must be done at the end of parsing all the tiles because in order to get the switch matrix sink wires, we must have a full routing map in place.

    • incrementalRemoveDuplicateTileResources

      protected void incrementalRemoveDuplicateTileResources(Tile t, WireEnumerator we)
      This function helps reduce memory footprint of the design parser by looking for duplicate objects after each tile object is created.

    • removeDuplicateWireArrays

      protected void removeDuplicateWireArrays(Tile t)

    • removeDuplicatePrimitivePinMaps

      protected void removeDuplicatePrimitivePinMaps()

    • createWireConnectionEnumeration

      protected void createWireConnectionEnumeration()

    • debugPoolCounts

      public void debugPoolCounts()

    • writeDeviceToCompactFile

      public boolean writeDeviceToCompactFile(String fileName)
      This function is used to write a compact version of the device to a file. The file can only be read by using the corresponding function readDeviceFromCompactFile().
      Parameters:
      fileName - Name of the file to create and store data for the device in the compact format
      Returns:
      True if operation is successful, false otherwise.

    • readDeviceFromCompactFile

      public boolean readDeviceFromCompactFile(String fileName)
      This reads from the compact device file to populate all of the essential variables of this device. It can only be used to read files generated with the writeDeviceToCompactFile() method.
      Parameters:
      fileName - The name of the compact device file
      Returns:
      True if operation was successful, false otherwise.

    • writeToDebugFile

      public void writeToDebugFile(String fileName, WireEnumerator we)
      This method is used only for debugging purposes.
      Parameters:
      fileName - Name of the debugging file.
